DefiningCitation: Page 58. Andersen et al. "The Hippocampus Book" 2007; Freund & Buzsaki 1996 p374 p418
Dentate gyrus IS-II cell.Definition: The IS (Interneuron-Specific) subpopulation of interneurons have axons that preferentially innervate other interneurons. The Dentate Gyrus IS-II class interneurons are visualized by immunostaining for Vasoactive Intestinal Polypeptide (VIP). The dendrites of Dentate gyrus IS-II cells are present in all layers of Dentate gyrus.
